CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DTPD unit |
| low band gap polymers |
| photovoltaic devices |
| plastic electronics |

The "Material Name" entities in the paragraph are "DTPD unit", "low band gap polymers", "photovoltaic devices", and "plastic electronics". These entities are mentioned as materials that are being studied or used in the context of the passage.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| DTPD unit |

After reviewing the entities, I have determined that only "DTPD unit" is a clear "Material Name" entity in the paragraph. The other entities, "low band gap polymers", "photovoltaic devices", and "plastic electronics", while they are materials, are not explicitly referred to as a specific material, but rather as a category or application of materials. Therefore, I have removed them from the list.

Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: In this study , we demonstrate , for the first time , that the DTPD unit is a promising electron - withdrawing building block for low band gap polymers , and it can be utilized to tailor the optical and electronic properties of conjugated polymers for photovoltaic devices and many other applications in plastic electronics.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| low band gap |
| optical properties |
| electronic properties |

Three property names were identified in the paragraph: "low band gap", "optical properties", and "electronic properties". These are all presented precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| low band gap |

After reviewing the paragraph again, only "low band gap" clearly refers to a material property. The other two phrases, "optical properties" and "electronic properties", are more general terms that could refer to properties of many different types of systems, not just materials. Therefore, only "low band gap" is included in the table.
